alert.note: Alert for Campbell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 4:31PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN CAMPBELL, EASTERN HAMILTON, EASTERN BUTLER, NORTHWESTERN CLERMONT, WARREN, SOUTHWESTERN GREENE AND SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM EDT... At 430 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over West Chester, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Hamilton, Kettering, Middletown, Fairfield, Mason, Miamisburg, Lebanon, Norwood, Forest Park, Springboro, Fort Thomas, Newport, Sharonville, Monroe, Blue Ash, Loveland, Franklin, Springdale and Reading. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 3 and 40. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 6 and 47. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
